name: "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles" (1987) Part 3 Trivia Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: Season 3, Episode 2: Where were the Turtles "on trial" during this episode?
options: In the court of public opinion.
questions.explanation:
On television.

	The episode was called "Turtles on Trial". There was a show within the show called "On Trial" where the host put controversial people in New York "on trial" for their crimes against the people. In this episode the Turtles were the focus of the host's ire.

questions.text: Season 3, Episode 3: Which friend of the Turtles was celebrating a birthday?
questions.explanation:
Irma.

	The episode was called "Attack of the 50-Foot Irma". Mikey was planning Irma's birthday party at the beginning of the episode when he realized he had forgotten to invite her.

questions.text: Season 3, Episode 5: Donatello gave some background information on what the Turtles were fighting early in the episode. He said the mob was using weapons straight out of which science fiction movie?
questions.explanation:
Star Wars.

	The episode was called "The Maltese Hamster". Last season there was a "Star Trek" reference and in this season a "Star Wars" reference. The writers really loved science fiction. The entire episode was a riff on film noir style movies with the Turtles trying to solve a crime involving the mob.

questions.text: Season 3, Episode 6: Which Turtle did the Shredder believe himself to be?
questions.explanation:
Mikey.

	The episode was called "Cowabunga Shredhead". Shredder was trying to create fake Turtles in a computer program. Something backfired and he was zapped into thinking he actually was Mikey. The Turtles then had to deal with having Shredder amongst them while they figured out what his plan had been.

questions.text: Season 3, Episode 7: Which character was deemed the fifth turtle?
questions.explanation:
Zach.

	The episode was called "The Fifth Turtle". Zach was a young boy who wanted nothing more than to be a friend to the Turtles. He tried to fight crime but only ended up getting himself in trouble.

questions.text: Season 3, Episode 8: What did the Turtles get Splinter for National Sensei Appreciation Day?
questions.explanation:
A sword.

	The episode was called "The Ninja Sword of Nowhere". The sword was made of an alien metal, though the Turtles didn't know that at the time. It had the ability to cut the fabric of space/time and let the user travel between dimensions.  Shredder stole the sword before the Turtles could give it to Splinter.

questions.text: Season 3, Episode 9: What new vehicle did Donnie unveil in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Turtle Tube.

	The episode was called "20,000 Leaks Under the City". The Turtle Tube was a giant inner tube that was gas powered and had weapons and a steering wheel. Donnie and Mikey were shown cruising the sewers in it while Donnie explained all the features.

questions.text: Season 3, Episode 10: What type of weather phenomenon was going on during the episode?
questions.explanation:
heat wave.

	The episode was called "Burne's Blues". There was a summer heat wave, putting the temperatures over 100 degrees in the city. The heat felt even worse as the episode featured a plot that centered around thieves stealing freon out of air conditioning units around the city.

questions.text: Season 3, Episode 11: What was special about the versions of Bebop and Rocksteady that were introduced in this episode?
options: They were each 10 feet tall and bullet-proof.
They were brainwashed into being  good guys.
They each wore tights and a cape.
questions.explanation:
They were robots.

	The episode was called "Super Bebop & Mighty Rocksteady". The super and mighty versions were robot clones created by Krang. They were 10 times stronger and smarter than the flesh and bone originals. Each only made one appearance in the series. The robot versions were near indestructible, but the Turtles found a way.

questions.text: Season 3, Episode 12: Which new villain was introduced in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Rat King.

	The episode was called "Enter the Rat King". Rat King was a strange man who also lived in the sewers, like the Turtles. He had no mutant abilities, but because he had lived in the sewers for so long, he developed the ability to communicate with and control rats.
